entries.content: Do you want to hang up now or let me have 30 seconds?
entries.notes: A direct conditional closing technique used at the start of a cold call.

entries.content: Offer the prospect a clear choice at the beginning of the call, typically between ending the call or giving a short amount of time.
entries.notes: This is the structure of the conditional close.

entries.content: Set a specific, short time limit (e.g., 30 seconds) when offering the prospect the option to listen.
Appeal to the prospect's rebellious nature by giving them permission to hang up; their instinct may be to do the opposite.
entries.notes: Psychological reason behind the 'hang up or listen' technique.

entries.content: Use language that creates parity and equality with senior decision-makers, sounding confident and belonging.
entries.notes: Applies to delivering the conditional close effectively ('let me have' vs 'may I have').

entries.content: If a prospect says they will hang up but doesn't immediately, challenge them gently: 'Well, you got to go first.'
entries.notes: A way to handle hesitation after the conditional close.

entries.content: When a prospect expresses a common frustration (e.g., about calls), ask 'Why does everybody say that?' to probe for specifics and encourage them to vent.
entries.notes: Handling a general objection/sentiment by asking 'what specifically?'

entries.content: Before you hang up, can I ask a question?
entries.notes: A conditional phrase to extend the conversation and probe.

entries.content: Before you go, one last thing then...
entries.notes: A conditional phrase to signal wrapping up while attempting one more point or question.

entries.content: Constantly give the prospect an implied exit ('before you go', 'before you hang up') to make it easier for them to keep talking.
If I was to guarantee that the next 30 seconds would be completely different... would you hear me out?
entries.notes: A conditional closing variation used after addressing a common objection.

entries.content: If a prospect says no to hearing you out, ask 'Is there any particular reason why?' to probe for the specific objection.
Be emotionally detached from the outcome when using these techniques; if they hang up after you offered, you can't feel bad.
entries.notes: Essential mindset for effective delivery and resilience.

focus_area: Handling "Think About It": "What specifically?", Conditional closing
